opendial.modules

Class ModuleExample2

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.modules.ModuleExample2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public class ModuleExample2
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
    Simple example of an asynchronous module for the domain specified in domains/examples/example-step-by-step.xml.

    The example creates a small control window where the user can click to provide directions to the agent.

    Version:
    $Date:: $
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModuleExample2

        public ModuleExample2(DialogueSystem system)
        Creates the example module. The module must have access to the dialogue system since it will periodically write new content to it.
        Parameters:
        system - the dialogue system

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws DialException
        Creates a small control window with 4 arrow buttons. When clicked, each button will create a new dialogue act corresponding to the instruction to perform, and add it to the dialogue state.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Module
        Throws:
        DialException - if the initialisation fails

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        state - the dialogue state
        updatedVars - the set of updated variables

        Pauses the module.
        Specified by:

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true is the module is not paused, and false otherwise.
